items.title: Rescue mission at Sultan Azlan Shah Dam after two fall into water

items.title: Five family members who perished in a predawn fire laid to rest in Raub
items.summary: RAUB: The remains of a family of five who died in a house fire in Kampung Pamah Kulat early Thursday morning (Feb 26) were laid to rest at the Bukit Gelugor Muslim Cemetery at approximately 11:45pm the same day. Read full story

items.title: Warmer winters leave Pakistan festival on thin ice
items.summary: HUNZA VALLEY, Pakistan, Feb 27 (Reuters) - Every winter for decades, the pool in front of Aleena Gul's house ⁠in Pakistan's Hunza Valley has transformed into an ice rink, framed by jagged Himalayan peaks and the stone walls of Altit Fort. Read full story

items.title: QuickCheck: Can eating petai help diabetics control their blood sugar?
items.summary: PETAI, also known as stink bean, is one of those love-it-or-hate-it ingredients in Malaysian cuisine. Its pungent smell can clear a room, yet it remains a favourite in dishes like sambal petai and petai fried rice. Read full story

Intuit reports Q2 revenue up 17% YoY to $4.65B, vs. $4.53B est., and forecasts Q3 revenue growth of ~10% and EPS below expectations; INTU drops 5%+ after hours  —  The company's profit guidance for its third quarter - which overlaps with peak tax season - came in short of Wall Street's expectations

items.title: Source: Meta has signed a multiyear deal to rent Google's TPUs to develop new models and has also been in talks to buy TPUs for its data centers as soon as 2027 (The Information)
items.summary:
The Information:
Source: Meta has signed a multiyear deal to rent Google's TPUs to develop new models and has also been in talks to buy TPUs for its data centers as soon as 2027  —  Meta Platforms has signed a deal to rent Google's AI chips, known as tensor processing units, to develop new AI models, according to a person involved in the talks.

It's the culmination of a dramatic exchange of public statements, social media posts, and behind-the-scenes negotiations, coming down to Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's desire to renegotiate all […]

items.title: Anthropic CEO stands firm as Pentagon deadline looms
items.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said Thursday that he "cannot in good conscience accede" to the Pentagon's demands to give the military unrestricted access to its AI systems.
